author: sTheFou

text: I haven't even gotten into the beta, but I watched so many streams of it during a week or two when the beta released that I could probably hop right in and know exactly what to do. That and my experience playing Pokemon card games as a kid (I was addicted, for a while all my savings went towards booster packs). I'm looking forward to playing this, but I do question its current depth and how long it will be able to retain its player base.
author: SupraDarky

text:
The depth is currently mage/rogue > All.
And there arent many enough cards to really make unique decks.
But i see huge potential if they can make more cards say.. .every 4-5 months
author: Puddimans

text: @Puddimans Ehh, currently the best class is probably the Warlock, with the next best classes being those that can do well against the Warlock, like the Druid. Pretty much any deck you make these days will not work if it's not built to deal with Warlock aggro. Rogue and Mage are two of the strongest in spite of their nerfs, though.

author: Mr. Fuzzums

text: Eh, most burn mages don't use pyroblast to kill you. It's the +1 Spell Damage legendary, Fireball > Frostbolt > Ice Lance = 16 damage in one turn you can do nothing about unless you're also a mage and happen to have played the Spell Bender secret. All they do is whittle you down to 16, then it's game over.
